etymology.description: 星 + 期 = star/celestial body + period/time → week; weekday marker.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “star period,” pointing to a time unit associated with celestial cycles. In modern usage it means “week” and, with a numeral, forms weekday names (e.g., 星期一).

parts.english: star; heavenly body; starlight; small amount

examples.chinese: 这个星期我很忙(這個星期我很忙)。
我们星期三见(我們星期三見)。
上星期下了很多雨(上星期下了很多雨)。
examples.pinyin: Shàng xīngqī xià le hěn duō yǔ.
examples.english: It rained a lot last week.
